text.0:
:scroll: President @MBuhari’s independence day speech included claims about #Nigeria’s population, military rule, falling government revenue & oil prices in other countries. 

But are they supported by facts? https://t.co/1WbSba2w8T
text.1:
How do you communicate uncertainty to ensure that the public detects, and understands, the limitations of evidence? This research briefing “How to communicate uncertainty” puts these questions under the microscope. 

Download the PDF: https://t.co/jH4952TRx2
text.2:
:pushpin: #Ethiopia #factchecking webinar: worried about the spread of false information & how it could affect the credibility of your work as a journalist or civil society organisation?
 
Register for our webinar taking place on 19 October. 
 
https://t.co/vxwWonC7HI
text.3:
:red_heart_selector: Is cardiovascular disease the “leading cause of death after HIV/Aids” in South Africa & “the most frequent cause of death worldwide today”, as claimed by @SAHeart_ZA?

We looked at the available data. https://t.co/LB9ZSgtQaU
